summary: Order management behavior updates for admin dashboard: rejected orders should be removed from the admin view (and in some cases deleted).
architectural_notes: Define rejection handling per actor: admin rejection triggers backend deletion; restaurant rejection triggers admin-dashboard-only removal.
known_issues: Draft app expiry and deployment failures occurred during attempts to deploy Version 37.

existing_features.title: Update the admin UI to remove restaurant-rejected orders from admin pages without affecting non-admin pages (customer/restaurant views). Specifically, the Admin Dashboard “All Orders” list should not render orders with status Rejected.

new_feature_requests.summary: When an admin rejects any order, permanently delete the order from the backend and make it immediately disappear from the admin dashboard (all order types).
When a restaurant rejects an order, remove that order from the admin dashboard only (restaurant view unaffected).
When an admin rejects an order, permanently delete the order from backend state so it no longer appears in any admin queries.

Ensure admin live orders endpoints do not return rejected orders, so that if an order’s status becomes #rejected (e.g., via restaurant rejection workflow), it is removed from the admin live orders view.

projectName: Remove restaurant-rejected orders from admin UI and permanently delete admin-rejected orders
